00028 std::vector<int> sieveOfEratosthenes(int upTo) {
00029     std::vector<int> sieve;
00030     sieve.reserve(upTo);
00031 
00032     // Zero and one aren't prime, by this definition.
00033     sieve.push_back(0);
00034     sieve.push_back(0);
00035 
00036     for (int p=2; p<upTo; ++p) sieve.push_back(p);
00037 
00038     std::vector<int> ret;
00039 
00040     int *p=&sieve[0], *e=p+upTo;
00041     while (p<e) {
00042         if (*p==0) { ++p; continue; }
00043         ret.push_back(*p);
00044 
00045         int *p2=p+(*p);
00046         while (p2<e) { *p2=0; p2+=*p; }
00047 
00048         ++p;
00049     }
00050 
00051     return ret;
00052 }
00053 
00054 // The Miller-Rabin Probabilistic Test of Primality
00055 int isProbablePrimeBaseB(const integer& n, const integer &b, callback_t
00056     callback)
00057 {
00058     const integer nMinus1(n - integer::one());
00059 
00060     // Find r and a satisfying: n-1=2^a * r, r odd
00061     integer r=nMinus1;
00062     unsigned long a=0;
00063     while (r.even()) { r >>= 1; ++a; }
00064 
00065     // We check the congruence class of b^((2^i)r) % n for each i
00066     // from 0 to a - 1. If any one is correct, then n passes.
00067     // Otherwise, n fails.
00068     integer test=powmod(b, r, n);
00069     if (test==integer::one() || test==nMinus1) return 1; // Better than 3/4 chance it's prime
00070 
00071     while (a-->0) {
00072         test=sqrmod(test, n);
00073         if (test==nMinus1) return 1;
00074     }
00075 
00076     if (callback && !callback()) return -1;
00077     return 0;
00078 }

00102 int is_prime(const integer& n, callback_t callback) {
00103     if (n < 2) throw std::invalid_argument("xint::is_prime cannot test numbers "
00104         "below 2");
00105 
00106     // First we trial-divide it by the primes below 2000
00107     static const std::vector<int> cLowPrimes(sieveOfEratosthenes(2000));
00108     std::vector<int>::const_iterator i=cLowPrimes.begin(), ie=cLowPrimes.end();
00109     for (; i!=ie; ++i) if ((n % *i)==0) return (n==*i);
00110 
00111     // Run the number through the Miller-Rabin Probabilistic Test of Primality
00112     // a few times to see if it's actually (probably) prime.
00113     for (int count=0; count<5; ++count) {
00114         unsigned int k=detail::get_random();
00115         int isP=isProbablePrimeBaseB(n, abs(k), callback);
00116         if (isP <= 0) return isP;
00117     }
00118     return 1; // Appears to be prime!
00119 }
00120 
00143 integer random_prime(size_t size_in_bits, callback_t callback) {
00144     if (size_in_bits < 2) throw std::invalid_argument("cannot create prime "
00145         "numbers smaller than two bits");
00146 
00147     // Call the callback for the first time
00148     if (callback && !callback()) return integer::zero();
00149 
00150     integer pe=pow2(size_in_bits+1);
00151     while (1) {
00152         integer p(random_by_size(size_in_bits, true, true));
00153         while (p < pe) {
00154             int r=is_prime(p, callback);
00155             if (r < 0) return integer::zero();
00156             if (r == 1) return p;
00157             p+=2;
00158         }
00159     }
00160 }
